Call boy and ex-heroin addict, Tom B: 'In West Berlin, everyone mixed and chose their scene'
description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (4/6). Tom B. came to West Berlin as a young gay man in the mid-1980s, became an escort and fell into drug addiction, just as AIDS began to strike. Now in his sixties, the sex worker and social worker has come a long way.

Glyphosate: French court clears Bayer-Monsanto of responsibility in birth defects case
description: In a judgment handed down Thursday, the court ruled that the severe birth defects of Théo Grataloup, now 18, could not be attributed to in utero exposure to glyphosate.

headline: Trump envoy to inspect Gaza aid as pressure mounts on Israel
description: The White House announced that US Special Envoy Steve Witkoff had a meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday ahead of his visit to Gaza the following day. Israel is under mounting international pressure to agree to a ceasefire and allow the world to flood Gaza with food.

headline: The friends who cement their platonic relationships through marriage
description: Difficult to quantify because they are often unofficial, unions between friends have been growing. They offer a way to honor friendship at a time when people are challenging the traditional, heteronormative couple and its conventions.

headline: Chef Thomas Besnault's sylvan inspiration
description: 'Chefs' Gardens' (2/5). At his restaurant Ardent, the young chef creates inventive cuisine using ingredients foraged from the woods of Esvres, in central France.

'White people shoot at us': Southern Brazil's Indigenous communities fight for ancestral land
description: In Mato Grosso do Sul, a southern state bordering Paraguay, Indigenous people who tried to reclaim the lands from which they had been dispossessed face violence from large landowners. The left-wing government largely remains powerless in the face of this tragedy.

headline: Journalists in the West Bank face mounting suppression
description: Since October 7, Israel has arrested and imprisoned at least 140 journalists working in this occupied territory, most often under the catch-all charge of 'incitement to terrorism.' The Palestinian Journalists Syndicate has condemned what it describes as a strategy to 'silence' media professionals.

headline: In the DRC, Chinese and American companies race for lithium
description: In the southeast of the Democratic Republic of Congo, the city of Manono sits atop the world's largest reserves of this mineral essential to the energy transition. A Chinese group signed the first contract there in 2022, followed this year by a California-based company.
